author: Lesley Waters
method: For the turkey, place the turkey pieces into a large bowl along with all of the other ingredients except the sesame seeds and mix well to combine. Heat a wok over a high heat, place the turkey into the wok and stir fry for 3-4 minutes. Add the sesame seeds to the wok and cook for a further minute. Meanwhile, for the vegetables, bring a medium saucepan of salted water to the boil, place the potatoes into the pan and boil for 3-4 minutes.  Add the beans to the pan and cook for 2-3 minutes, then add the carrots and cook for 1-2 minutes, or until all of the vegetables are tender.  Drain the vegetables and transfer to a bowl. Pour over the oils and mix well to coat the vegetables. To serve, place the vegetables onto a plate with the turkey stir-fry on top.
ingredients: 200g/7oz turkey breast, chopped,  2 tbsp soy sauce,  2 tbsp runny honey,  2 tbsp olive oil,  2 tbsp sesame seeds,  50g/1¾oz new potatoes, thinly sliced,  50g/1¾oz green beans, trimmed,  ½ carrot, peeled, cut into ribbons,  1 tbsp olive oil,  1 tbsp sesame oil
